prompt: Ich erhalte keine Benachrichtigungen über meine eigene Aktivität. Wie kann ich Benachrichtigungen für meine eigenen Aktionen aktivieren?
expected_answer: Standardmäßig erhält man keine Benachrichtigungen über die eigene Aktivität (es sei denn, das Ereignis, das die Benachrichtigung auslöst, richtet sich explizit an diesen Benutzer). Sie haben die Möglichkeit, diesen Filter in den "Erweiterten Filteroptionen" Ihrer eigenen Benachrichtigungseinstellungen in Ihrem Benutzerprofil zu deaktivieren.
ai_answer:
https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/ 
https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Security%20Module 
https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Attachment/Validation/UI/ 
https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/XWikiSyntax/ 


Um Benachrichtigungen für Ihre eigenen Aktionen in XWiki zu aktivieren, können Sie die Benachrichtigungseinstellungen anpassen. Hier sind die Schritte, die Sie befolgen können:

1. **Navigieren Sie zu Ihren Benachrichtigungseinstellungen**:
   - Gehen Sie zu Ihrem Benutzerprofil, indem Sie auf Ihren Benutzernamen oben rechts auf der Seite klicken.
   - Wählen Sie "Benachrichtigungseinstellungen" oder einen ähnlichen Menüpunkt aus.

2. **Anpassen der Benachrichtigungseinstellungen**:
   - In den Benachrichtigungseinstellungen sollten Sie verschiedene Optionen sehen, einschließlich der Möglichkeit, Benachrichtigungen für Ihre eigenen Aktionen zu aktivieren.
   - Suchen Sie nach einer Option wie "Benachrichtigungen über eigene Aktionen" oder "Selbstbenachrichtigungen".
   - Aktivieren Sie diese Option, um Benachrichtigungen über Ihre eigenen Aktivitäten zu erhalten.

3. **Speichern Sie Ihre Einstellungen**:
   - Stellen Sie sicher, dass Sie Ihre Änderungen speichern, indem Sie auf "Speichern" oder eine ähnliche Schaltfläche klicken.

Falls Sie diese Optionen nicht finden können, könnte es sein, dass Ihre XWiki-Installation eine spezifische Konfiguration oder Erweiterung benötigt. In diesem Fall sollten Sie die Dokumentation Ihrer XWiki-Version konsultieren oder sich an Ihren XWiki-Administrator wenden.

Hier sind einige nützliche Links aus der XWiki-Dokumentation, die Ihnen weiterhelfen könnten:
- [Benachrichtigungen](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/)
- [Benachrichtigungseinstellungen](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/NotificationsApplicationsPreferencesMacro)

Falls diese Informationen nicht ausreichen, können Sie auch die allgemeinen Einstellungen für Benachrichtigungen in der XWiki-Dokumentation nachlesen oder die XWiki-Community um Hilfe bitten.

Menu application

![bell](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/resources/icons/silk/bell.png?cache-version=1711538036000)

[Notifications](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/)  
Display notifications about events happening in the wiki.

![invitation.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Invitation%20Application/invitation.png?rev=1.3)

[Invitation](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Invitation%20Application)  
Allows users to send emails, inviting friends and colleagues to join a wiki

# Other Features

Other features can be added to your wiki by [installing](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Extension%20Manager%20Application) extensions not listed above. Check the [Extensions wiki](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/) for a full list of available extensions.

Therefore, the real task of settling access decisions is entirely delegated to customizable components that may be introduce by third parties and configured without rebuilding the platform. The component hint of the AuthorizationSettler may be configured from the ConfigurationSource (xwiki.properties) using the key security.authorization.settler. The default hint "default" is implemented by the DefaultAuthorizationSettler. Another experimental PriorityAuthorizationSettler (currently unmaintained, use at your own risk) is also bundled. Both are based on a AbstractAuthorizationSettler which provide a common foundation for merging access provide at each hierarchy level based on a customizable dynamic policy.

### Right definitions

Since the settling process is delegated to the AuthorizationSettler, the interpretation of right definitions is up to it, and right definition is only a tool for helping the creation of an expandable authorization settler, allowing new rights to be easily externally defined. New Right maybe registered with the AuthorizationManager using a RightDescription. The meaning of the right definition explained here is mostly pertinent for the default implementation of the AuthorizationSettler, and should normally be followed by any other settler implementation, but this could not be guaranteed.

#-# Define the list of blocked attachment mimetypes. By default, this list is empty, but you can specify a   
#-# comma-separated list of blocked mimetypes. Note that a joker (\*) can be used to accept any media type. Once this   
#-# list is not empty, any attachment matching one of the listed mimetype will be rejected.  
#-# For instance, if you want to reject plain text and any kind of images, you can set the list to:  
#-# text/plain,image/\*  
#-#  
# attachment.upload.blockList=## Administration UI

[![attachment_restriction_admin.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Attachment/Validation/UI/WebHome/attachment_restriction_admin.png?width=960&rev=1.1)](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Attachment/Validation/UI/WebHome/attachment_restriction_admin.png?rev=1.1)

The mimetype restrictions can also be configured at wiki or space level through the administration UI, by visiting the Attachments Restriction section of the administration.

Therefore, you are strongly encouraged to use the new checkAccess() method everywhere you check an access before action. And you should refrain to catch the resulting exception, this should be done at higher level, by the UI which will therefore be able to centralize all access check violations. (Obviously this is a work in progress that we are starting now and will only properly work when the full migration of the old service is completed). Also note that, access violation done during checkAccess() are logged. In most situation, this should not happen, since the UI, or earlier code have already checked the possibility for access, and does not provide a path to the prohibited action. Remember also, that checking the same access several time is no more cost full, so checking access very near the action (even if you think there is no reason it would be denied) is good security measure to prevent security bugs. This is clearly the purpose of the checkAccess() method.

## Some definitions as seen by this module

| [notifications](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/Macro/NotificationsMacro) | Notifications | Notifications | Display notifications about events happened on the wiki. | Current Wiki |
| [notificationsApplicationsPreferences](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/NotificationsApplicationsPreferencesMacro) | Notifications Applications Preferences | Notifications | Display the preferences of the current user about notification applications. | Current Wiki |
| [notificationsAutoWatchPreferences](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/NotificationsAutoWatchPreferencesMacro) | Notifications Auto Watch Preferences | Notifications | Display the preferences of the current user about auto watched pages. | Current Wiki |
| [notificationsCustomFiltersPreferences](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/NotificationsCustomFiltersPreferencesMacro) | Notifications Custom Filters Preferences | Notifications | Display the preferences of the given user about custom notification filters. | Current Wiki |
| [notificationsEmailPreferences](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/NotificationsEmailPreferencesMacro) | Notifications Email Preferences | Notifications | Display the preferences of the current user about notification emails. | Current Wiki |
| [notificationsFiltersPreferences](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Notifications/Code/NotificationsFiltersPreferencesMacro) | Notifications Filters Preferences (deprecated) | Notifications | Display the preferences of the current user about notification filters.This macro is now deprecated in favor of Custom Notifications Filters Preferences or System Notifications Filters Preferences. | Current Wiki |
